 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָחַשׁ‎</span>] **verb** ==whisper, charm== (Late Hebrew ***id.***; Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לְחַשׁ‎</span> <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; ***whisper***, see [[BDB#RS|RS]]<sup>JPh xiv. 1885, 122, possibly</sup> originally serpent-charming); — 

**Pi\`el** ***Participle*** plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קוֺל מְלַחֲשִׁים‎</span> [[Ps.58.6|Ps 58:6]] ***voice of whisperers*** (i.e. ***serpent-charmers***; \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חוֺבֵר תֲבָרִים‎</span>). **Hithpa\`el** ***whisper together***, ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִתְלַחֲשׁוּ‎</span> with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַל‎</span> [[Ps.41.8|Ps 41:8]] ***Participle*** plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִתְלַחֲשִׁים‎</span> [[2Sam.12.19|2Sam 12:19]].
